newsitem.title: USA: FEMA unveils on-line storm watch page.
newsitem.headline: FEMA unveils on-line storm watch page.

text.p: The Federal Emergency Management Agency said Thursday it would launch a Tropical Storm Watch page on the Internet's World Wide Web May 30, just in time for the beginning of the 1997 hurricane season.
The page, now in its third year, has proven enormously successful, enabling people in hurricane-prone regions to track storms heading their way.
For instance, the site logged 400,000 hits Sept. 5, 1996, the day that Hurricane Fran made landfall in North Carolina.
The FEMA site, updated daily and sometimes hourly, offers hurricane preparedness information, fact sheets, maps, and links to other sites with weather satellite images and forecasts.
The FEMA homepage address is http://www.fema.gov.
